results.title: Nutcracker
results.brief_description: The Pacific Northwest Ballet features in this motion picture version of the story by E.T.A. Hoffmann with music by Peter Illich Tchaikovsky. It is New Year’s Eve. Clara’s parents have arranged a party for their daughter. The dollmaker has prepared a suprise for the children - a puppet show - but best of all is a doll, the nutcracker. Clara sleeps, after a day of celebrations, and dreams of a collage of impressions from the day. The fantasy includes the transformation of her nutcracker into a handsome prince, his battle and victory with the Wicked Mouse king, beautiful puppets, dancing snowflakes and a giant Christmas tree. The London Symphony Orchestra, conducted by Sir Charles MacKerras, lends magic to the star performers which include: Hugh Bigney (Herr Drosselmeir), Vanessa Sharp (Young Clara), Patricia Barker (Dream Clara) and Wade Walthall (Nutcracker). Costumes designed by Maurice Sendak.

results.title: Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan
results.creator_credit: Jerome de Missolz, Jean-Paul Guillemard, Gerard Pont, Gerard Lacroix, Morgane Production and La Sept-Arte
results.brief_description: Documentary about Pakistani musician Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan, a unique singer revered for his contribution to world music. Khan performs Qawwli, an ancient time-honoured Soufi music that is reputed to be sung on earth by prophets of Mohammad. Now deceased, Khan benefited from the promotional efforts of Peter Gabriel, which lead to collaborations with well-known singers Bjork and Jeff Buckley. Classically trained, Khan played traditional instruments such as the tabla, sarangi, sitar, dilruba and sarod, often favouring the harmonium as accompaniment. In an extensive recent and enlightening interview Khan discusses his upbringing and music tutelage at the hands of his father - Qawwli custom dictates that the teachings are passed from father to eldest son. Features an array of stunning performances from Khan, some performed mid-interview, which showcase his exceptional style, noble talents and evident respect for culture.

results.title: Nursing: recreational and cccupational therapy
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education and Ted Nemeth Studios
results.brief_description: Shows the role of the nurse in the rehabilitation of a teen-age boy who had a spinal injury, by using physical, functional, occupational and diversional therapy.

results.title: Nursery rhymes and songs
results.brief_description: Children of the Ravenscourt Theatre School sing and perform traditional nursery rhymes and songs including “Polly put the kettle on”, “Daddy wouldn’t buy me a bow wow”, “Old King Cole” and “Mary had a little lamb”.

results.title: Nursery rhyme favourites. Vol. 2
results.brief_description: This program consists of a collection of well-known and well-loved children’s nursery rhymes presented by Elka Laine and Peter Walters. First each story is told by either Elka or Peter accompanied by colourful but simple illustrations of the key characters from each nursery rhyme. Then Elka and Peter sing and act out each rhyme two or three times to music, encouraging their young viewers to join in with them. Assists in the teaching of young children the art of listening and storytelling, music and singing, and using their imagination to act out each of the rhymes. Music by Kevin McMullen. Illustrations by Kate McKague.

results.title: Nurse Betty [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Neil LaBute, Gail Mutrux, Steve Golin, Universal Pictures, AB'-Strakt Pictures, Propaganda Films and IMF (DE)
results.brief_description: Nurse Betty is a black comedy directed by Neil LaBute (In the company of men, Your friends and neighbours). Renee Zellweger (Bridget Jones’s diary) stars as Betty Sizemore, a big-hearted waitress living in Fair Oakes, Kansas with her boorish, abusive, cheating husband Del (Aaron Eckhart). Unbeknownst to Betty, Del is involved in some shady business dealings. One night when Betty is engrossed in her favourite soap, “A Reason to love”, Del is crudely murdered by two hit men, Wesley (Chris Rock) and Charlie (Morgan Freeman). Rather than believe reality, Betty believes the screen and goes off in search of her long lost love ‘Dr David Ravell’, the main character on her favourite show. The two hit men who killed her husband, each of whom make very different assumptions about their prey, pursue Betty across country. Once in LA, Betty strikes up a friendship with Rosa (Tia Texada) who reluctantly helps her track down her mythical doctor, played by Greg Kinnear. Renee Zellweger is funny and convincing as the naive, Betty, and won Best Actress in a comedy/musical at the Golden Globes, 2001.

results.title: Nureyev
results.creator_credit: Patricia Foy, Reiner Moritz, Orfeo Films and Antelope Films
results.brief_description: No performer on the world stage has received so much acclaim and publicity as Rudolf Nureyev, and no one has given away so little about their private life and thinking. From his home on the Mediterranean island of Il Gali, Nureyev reminisces about his life, from his home town of Ufa in the central Soviet Union, to his time at the Kirov and his defection to the West in 1961. This definitive biography chronicles the truths and legends surrounding the fiery Tartar, and incorporates extensive archival material of Nureyev’s most famous roles, including Le Corsaire, Sleeping Beauty, Marguerite and Armand, Apollo, Aureole, Don Quixote, Cinderella and Pierrot Lunaire.

results.title: Nuovo Cinema Paradiso
results.creator_credit: Giuseppe Tornatore, Franco Cristaldi, TRE, Radiotelevisione Italiana, TFI, Cristaldifilm and Ariane
results.brief_description: Tornatore’s loving homage to the world of movies. A celebration of cinema - its mystery, its fascination and its capacity to make us laugh, cry and dream. Through the eyes of the adult Toto, we relive his childhood and adolescence in the small Sicilian village of Giancaldo, and especially his relationship with Alfredo (Philippe Noiret) the Cinema Paradiso’s gentle and wise old projectionist. Hidden together high up in the projection box, they grow to share a special love of movies that outlives Toto’s rocky path to manhood. Hailed worldwide by critics and the public alike, this film is a glowingly warm tribute to the innocence of childhood, the anguish of first love and the emotional power of the cinema. English subtitles.

results.title: Numerals everywhere
results.creator_credit: Gary Bergland and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Using music and natural sounds, without narration, emphasises numerals in a child’s largely urban environment. Car license plates, house numbers, speed limit signs, a petrol pump at the garage, numerals on money, labels on food, a cash register, show that numerals are everywhere. Encourages children to develop an awareness of numerals in their everyday experience.
